oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Disable unauthenticated repositories in APT configuration
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Accessing a repository should be allowed only when the repository is authenticated.

oval-def:criteria.comment: Detect any usage of allow-unauthenticated option

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure at is restricted to authorized users
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: On many systems, only the system administrator is authorized to schedule at jobs. Using the at.allow file to control who can run at jobs enforces this policy. It is easier to manage an allow list than a deny list. In a deny list, you could potentially add a user ID to the system and forget to add it to the deny files.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure cron is restricted to authorized users
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: On many systems, only the system administrator is authorized to schedule cron jobs. Using the cron.allow file to control who can run cron jobs enforces this policy. It is easier to manage an allow list than a deny list. In a deny list, you could potentially add a user ID to the system and forget to add it to the deny files.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure mail transfer agent is configured for local-only mode
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: The software for all Mail Transfer Agents is complex and most have a long history of security issues. While it is important to ensure that the system can process local mail messages, it is not necessary to have the MTA's daemon listening on a port unless the server is intended to be a mail server that receives and processes mail from other systems.
